Based on your preferences, I would highly recommend watching "Mulholland Drive" (1999). This movie is a masterful blend of surrealism, mystery, and drama, which creates an immersive and captivating viewing experience.

The movie revolves around a woman named Diane Selby (played by Naomi Watts), who wakes up in her own house, with no memories of how she ended up there. However, as time progresses, Diane starts to uncover the dark secrets and mysteries behind her sudden arrival at this seemingly perfect family's house in Beverly Hills, California.

Overall, "Mulholland Drive" is a cinematic masterpiece that explores the depths of human psychology, ambition, desire, love, and betrayal.

If you enjoy movies that challenge your mind, explore the depths of human psychology, ambition, desire, love, and betrayal, then I highly recommend checking out "Mulholland Drive" (1999).
